page.title: 12The Railways
page.content: Today the only obvious evidence of railways is the main East Coast line with regular '125' trains running almost north-south through the area.Careful observation however reveals much more. Beside Hag Lane Bridge are a row of houses named Station Cottages.If you look just to their side there is the raised platform which used to be Raskelf station,which was built in 1841.Not only was it used to transport goods to and from local farms by cart but there was a branch line going off to Scarborough with trains every hour.A mile or so to the east a raised hump on Crankley Lane is evidence of a level crossing and shows yet another disused railway _ the York-Easingwold line closed in the 1950's due to competition from road haulage.
